Silvopasture

Silvopasture in British Columbia Information Series

Learn about the basics of planning, implementing and managing a silvopasture.

Presented by the British Columbia Ministry of Agriculture and Food. Hosted by Dr. George Powell, consulting Agrologist. Moderated by Dr. Lisa Zabek, Agroforestry Specialist, Extension Support Services Branch.

2025 Silvopasture Webinars

Join us for four nights of free, producer-focused presentations on establishing and managing a silvopasture in British Columbia. Learn about why it might be, and has been, used:

  • Enhance and diversify production
  • Buffer drought, heat and extreme weather
  • Reduce wildfire risks
Learn about where it is being used in BC:
  • Case studies and producer experience
  • Resources to help support your management
British Columbia agricultural producers attending the webinars will have the opportunity to register for additional, free, one-on-one consultations with topic experts following the webinar presentations.

Agenda

Tuesday February 25, 2025, 6 to 8 pm PST

  • Introduction to Silvopasture
  • Case Study

Thursday February 27, 2025, 6 to 8 pm PST

  • The Science Behind Silvopasture
  • Case Study

Tuesday March 4, 2025, 6 to 8 pm PST

  • Silvopasture Beneficial Management Practices Parts 1 & 2

Thursday March 6, 2025, 6 to 8 pm PST

  • Silvopasture Planning

Registration

Webinars are free, but space is limited.

Click here to access the registration website at Eventbrite.
